partintro.title: Opcodes
partintro.simpara: This page lists and partially documents all the opcodes generated by Zend Engine 2 when it parses PHP files. Opcodes may be dumped for a given PHP file using the vld extension (see &url.pecl.package;vld).

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Adds "value1" to "value2" and stores the result into "result". * opcode number: 1 */ echo 1 + 2; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Add elem-value as an element to array-value
 * opcode number: 72
 */
$a = array(1,2,3);
print_r($a);
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * add character value2 to string value1 and store in result * opcode number: 54 */ echo "hello\ world"; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 144 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 145 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * add string value2 to string value2 and store in result * opcode number: 55 */ echo "hello$a world"; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * add contents of variable in value2 to string value1 and store in result * opcode number: 56 */ echo "hello$a world"; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * assigns value1 to result
 * opcode number: 38
 */
$a=1;
$a='a';
$a=new A();
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Add value1 to value2 and store in variable indicated by value1 * opcode number: 23 */ $a+=3; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Performs binary AND on result and value1 and stores in variable indicated by result. * opcode number: 32 */ $a &= 64; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Performs binary OR on result and value1 and stores in variable indicated by result. * opcode number: 31 */ $a |= 64; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Performs binary XOR on result and value1and stores in variable indicated by result. * opcode number: 33 */ $a ^= 64; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Concats string values result and value1 and store in variable indicated by result * opcode number: 30 */ $a .= 'z'; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Divide result by value1and store in variable indicated by result. * opcode number: 26 */ $a/=3; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Perform result mod value1 and store in variable indicated by result * opcode number: 27 */ $a %= 3; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Multiply result by value1 and store in variable indicated by result * opcode number: 25 */ $a*=3; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 136 */ $obj->a = $otherobj; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * indicates that variable indicated by value1 is to be treated in the global scope for the remainder of the current scope. * opcode number: 39 */ global $a; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Shift result by value1 bits to left and store in variable indicated by result * opcode number: 28 */ $a <<= 3; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Shift result by value1 bits to right and store in variable indicated by result * opcode number: 29 */ $a >>= 3; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Subtract value1 from value2 and store in variable indicated by value1 * opcode number: 24 */ $a-=3; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * prepare to perform function call without displaying error messages
 * opcode number: 57
 */
/* Intentional file error */
$my_file = @file ('non_existent_file') or
   die ("error:'$php_errormsg'");
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * convert value1 to boolean and store in result??????????
 * opcode number: 52
 */
if (1 || 2 || 1) echo "foo";
//$a = true;
//if($a) echo "foo";
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Boolean (logical) not of "value" * opcode number: 13 */ echo !1; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Boolean (logical) xor of value1 * opcode number: 14 */ echo 1 xor 2; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * ???  End of a case block exists the current switch block.  Followed by JMP?
 * opcode number: 50
 */
$x = 0;
while(1) {
    if($x == 0) break;
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 51 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Bit-wise and of value1 and value2 * opcode number: 10 */ echo 1&2; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Bit-wise not of "value" * opcode number: 12 */ echo ~15; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Bit-wise or of value1 and value2 * opcode number: 9 */ echo 1|2; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Bit-wise xor of value1 and value2 * opcode number: 11 */ echo 1^2; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Set result to true if value1 equals value2.  The value2 must be a constant value?
 * opcode number: 48
 */
$i=0;
switch ($i) {
   case 0:
         echo "i=0";
         break;
   case 1:
         echo "i=1";
         break;
   case 2:
         echo "i=2";
         break;
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * casts value1 as type value2 (?? Not certain about arguments ??) * opcode number: 21 */ echo (int)1; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 107
 */
try {
    $error = 'Always throw this error';
    throw new Exception($error);

    // Code following an exception is not executed.
    echo 'Never executed';

} catch (Exception $e) {
    echo 'Caught exception: ',  $e->getMessage(), "\n";
}

// Continue execution
echo 'Hello World';
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 110
 */
$obj = new A();
$copy = clone $obj;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 111 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Concats string values string1 and string2 * opcode number: 8 */ echo "hello" . "world"; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Declare a class with the name of class-name as the implementation specified by ID.
 * opcode number: 139
 */
class A {
    function methodA(){
        echo "hello world";
    }
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 141
 */
class A{
 function funcA(){
 }
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 140
 */
 if($b){
 class Foo {
  public static $my_static = 'foo';
  public function staticValue() {
    return self::$my_static;
  }
 }

 class Bar extends Foo {
  public function fooStatic() {
     echo parent::$my_static;
  }
 }
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Divides "value1" by "value2" and stores the result into "result". * opcode number: 4 */ echo 6/3; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Call a function. Following multiple SEND_VAL, SEND_VAR or SEND_REF. * opcode number: 60 */ $a = phpinfo(); ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Call a function by name.  Following INIT_FCALL_BY_NAME and multiple SEND_VAL, SEND_VAR or SEND_REF.
 * opcode number: 61
 */
$x = 'phpinfo';
$a = $x();
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Dump text * opcode number: 40 */ echo "hello world"; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * no longer surpress error messages * opcode number: 58 */ $my_file = @file ('non_existent_file') or die ("error:'$php_errormsg'"); ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Exit running after dumping "message". * opcode number: 79 */ die("foobar"); ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 102 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 103 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 104 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 101 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 109 */ $obj = new A(); ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch the constant value bound to the specified name (name) and stores it into a variable (result).
 * opcode number: 99
 */
define("FOO", "something");
echo FOO;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 100 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 93
 */

function foo(&$x)
{
  print($x);
}

$x = array(0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5);
$z = "foo";

$z($x[0]);

?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 90 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch the value of the element at "index" in "array-value" to store it in "result".  Read-only?
 * opcode number: 81
 */
$x = array(1,2,3);
$a = 'x';
echo $$a[0];
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch the value of the element at "index" in "array-value" to store it in "result".
 * opcode number: 87
 */
$x = array(1,2,3);
$a = 'x';
$$a[0]++;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Fetch an entry of an array from a temporal variable? * opcode number: 98 */ list($x) = array("X"); ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Fetch an entry of an array variable for the purpose of unset() operation. * opcode number: 96 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch the value of the element at "index" in "array-value" to store it in "result".  Write-only?
 * opcode number: 84
 */
$a = 1;
while($a > 0){
    $a = 0;
}
/*$input =array(1,2,3);
while (list($var,) = @each($input)){
    unset($$var);
}*/
/*$a = array(1,2,3);
$x = 'a';
$$x[0] = 1;*/

/*while ($b = each($a)) {
  print $b;
}*/


?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 92
 */
function foo($x)
{
}

$x = 1;
$y = "x";
$z = "foo";

$z($$y);

?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch the value from variable which is to be used to test if it is set or not, through isset()/isempty().
 * opcode number: 89
 */
echo isset($_SESSION['userid']);
echo isset($_SESSION['userid'][1]);
echo isset($_SESSION->prop->prop);
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 94
 */
include './classA.php';

function foo(&$x)
{
  print($x);
}

$z = "foo";

$obj = new A();
print $obj->num;
$z($obj->num);

?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 91 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch the "prop-name" property value of this object.  Read-only?
 * opcode number: 82
 */
$x = new A();
$a = 'x';
echo $$a->num;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch the "prop-name" property value of this object.
 * opcode number: 88
 */
$x = new A();
$a = 'x';
$$a->num++;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Fetch a property of an object variable for the purpose of unset() operation. * opcode number: 97 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch the "prop-name" property value of this object.  Write-only?
 * opcode number: 85
 */
$x = new A();
$a = 'x';
$$a->num = 1;;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch the value of the varible of "name" to assign it to a variable?  Read-only?
 * opcode number: 80
 */
$x = 1;
$a = 'x';
echo $$a;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch the value of the varible of "name" to assign it to a variable?
 * opcode number: 86
 */
$x = 1;
$a = 'x';
$$a++;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Fetch a variable for the purpose of unset() operation. * opcode number: 95 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch the value of the varible of "name" to assign it to a variable?  Write-only?
 * opcode number: 83
 */
$x = 1;
$a = 'x';
$$a = 2;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Fetch an element from iterator.  If no element is available, jump to address.  Followed by OP_DATA?
 * opcode number: 78
 */
$a = array(1,2,3);
foreach($a as $num){
    print $num;
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Initialize an iterator on array-value.  If the array is empty, jump to address.  Followed by FE_FETCH.
 * opcode number: 77
 */
$a = array(1,2,3);
foreach($a as $num){
    print $num;
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Release the allocated space of the value. * opcode number: 70 */ print "Hello World"; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 149 */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Include the file specified by filename and eval it.
 * opcode number: 73
 */
include("test.php");
eval("test.php");
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Allocate a new array with elem-value as the first element of the array.  Followed by ADD_ARRAY_ELEMENT.
 * opcode number: 71
 */
$a = array(1,2,3);
print_r($a);
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * prepare for a function call to function value1
 * opcode number: 59
 */
$x = 'phpinfo';
$a = $x();
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Prepare for a method call.  Followed by DO_FCALL.
 * opcode number: 112
 */
class A {
  var $num;
    function incrementNum(){
    $num++;
  }
}

$obj = new A();
$obj->incrementNum();

?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 113
 */
class Foo {
    public static function aStaticMethod() {
            echo "hello world\n";
    }
}

Foo::aStaticMethod();
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * appears to create a string variable in result * opcode number: 53 */ echo "hello$a world"; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 138
 */
$obj = new A();

if ($obj instanceof A) {
   echo 'A';
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Tests if the entry of an array is set or not. * opcode number: 115 */ if(isset($a[0])) return 0; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 148
 */
$obj = new A();
if(empty($obj->num)) return 0;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Tests if the value of a variable is set or not. * opcode number: 114 */ if(isset($a)){ return 0;} ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * compares if value1 and value2 are equal
 * opcode number: 17
 */
echo (1 == 1);
echo (1 == 'c');
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Compares value1 and value2 to see if they are equal AND have the same type
 * opcode number: 15
 */
echo (1===1);
echo (1==='a');
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * compares if value1 and value2 are not equal * opcode number: 18 */ echo (1 != 1); ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * compares value1 and value2 to see if they are unequal or of different types * opcode number: 16 */ echo (1 !== 1); ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * compares if value1 is less than value2 * opcode number: 19 */ echo (1 < 2); ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * compares if value1 is less than or equal to value2 * opcode number: 20 */ echo (1 >= 2); ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Jump to the address if the value is not zero
 * opcode number: 44
 */
for($i=0; $i<3; $i++){ 
    echo "hi";
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Jump to the address if the xor of value1 and value2 is zero .. ??? * opcode number: 47 */ if(1^2) return; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 42 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Jump to the address if the value is zero * opcode number: 43 */ if($a != 0) echo "foo"; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Jump to the address if the value is .. ???
 * opcode number: 45
 */
for($i=0; $i<3; $i++){ 
    echo "hi";
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php /* * Jump to the address if the xor of value1 and value2 is zero .. ??? * opcode number: 46 */
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Makes the value of "result" congruent to "value1" modulo "value2". * opcode number: 5 */ echo 6 % 3; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Multiplys "value1" by "value2" and stores the result into "result". * opcode number: 3 */ echo 2*3; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Construct an instance of "type" and store the reference to the object into "result". * opcode number: 68 */ $obj = new A(); ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 69 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * no operation * opcode number: 0 */ function A(){}; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * decrements variable indicated by value1 by 1 (after performing other operations) and stores in result * opcode number: 37 */ $a--; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 135
 */
$obj = new A();
$obj->num--;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * increments variable indicated by value1 by 1 (after performing other operations) and stores in result * opcode number: 36 */ $a++; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Increment the property value specified by prop-name and store the original value into result.
 * opcode number: 134
 */
$obj = new A();
$obj->num++;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * decrements variable indicated by value1 by 1 (before performing other operations) and stores in results * opcode number: 35 */ --$a; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 133
 */
$obj = new A();
--$obj->num;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * increments variable indicated by value1 by 1 (before performing other operations) and stores in result * opcode number: 34 */ ++$a; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 132
 */
$obj = new A();
++$obj->num;
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 41 */ print "Hello World"; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Question Mark Assign, used twice inside a question mark assign to temporarily assign result as value1  (this is followed up with an ASSIGN bytecode)
 * opcode number: 22
 */
function A(){
 echo 1?2:3;
}

function B(){
 $b = 0;
 $a = $b > 1 ? 10: 11;
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 142
 */

abstract class fail {
    abstract function show();
}

class pass extends fail {
    function show() {
        echo "Call to function show()\n";
    }
}

$t2 = new pass();
$t2->show();

$t = new fail();
$t->show();

echo "Done\n"; // shouldn't be displayed
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 143 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Receive a functoin argument of "argument-number" and store the argument value into a variable of "argument-number". (e.g. $1 for 1) * opcode number: 63 */ function hello($a){} ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Initialize a function argument with "value" if not received from caller. Otherwise same as RECV. * opcode number: 64 */ function hello($a=5){} ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Return value from a funciton. * opcode number: 62 */ return 1; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Pass the reference value as an actual parameter to a function.  DO_FCALL follows.
 * opcode number: 67
 */
@each($input);
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Pass the constant value as an actual parameter to a function.  DO_FCALL follows.
 * opcode number: 65
 */
function funcA($msg){
    print $msg;
}

funcA('HELLO');

defined('IN_PHPBB');
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Pass the variable value as an actual parameter to a function.  DO_FCALL follows.
 * opcode number: 66
 */
$a = array(1,2,3);
if(is_array($a)){ return 0; }
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * * opcode number: 106 * No sample PHP yet */ ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Shift value1 by balue2 bits to left * opcode number: 6 */ echo 8 << 2; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Shift bits to right * opcode number: 7 */ echo 8 >> 2; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting: <?php /* * Subtracts "value2" from "value1" and stores the result into "result". * opcode number: 2 */ echo 1-2; ?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Release the allocated space of "value"?
 * opcode number: 49
 */
$a = array(1,2,3);
foreach($a as $num){
    print $num;
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 108
 */
try {
    $error = 'Always throw this error';
    throw new Exception($error);

    // Code following an exception is not executed.
    echo 'Never executed';

} catch (Exception $e) {
    echo 'Caught exception: ',  $e->getMessage(), "\n";
}

// Continue execution
echo 'Hello World';
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * 
 * opcode number: 105
 */
// A function that records the time when it is called
function profile()
{
   echo "profile function is called\n";
}

// Set up a tick handler
register_tick_function("profile");

// Initialize the function before the declare block
profile();

// Run a block of code, throw a tick every 2nd statement
declare(ticks=2) {
   for ($x = 0; $x < 10; ++$x) {
         echo "hello world\n";
   }
}
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Unset the entry of array-value, which is specified by index, and store the original element value into "result".
 * opcode number: 75
 */
$a = array(1,2,3);
unset($a[0]);
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Unset the property of the current object (this) and store the original value into "result".
 * opcode number: 76
 */
$obj = new A();
unset($obj->num);
?>

section.title: PHP code
section.programlisting:
<?php
/*
 * Unset the variable and store the original value into "result".
 * opcode number: 74
 */
$x = 1;
$a='x';
unset($$a);
